text: [Music]
hey guys it's ro welcome to another
nerdy nummies i got so many requests
from you guys to make a hatchimal themed
cake so that is exactly what i'm gonna
be doing today if you aren't familiar
with hatchimals they are adorable toys
that now i have fallen in love with i
invited my friend sam over to help me
hatch some hatchimals it was the first
time that we had ever done this and it
was so much fun they're little animals
that are half bird half another creature
and they come in a little shell and you
nurture them and they actually peck
through the shell they learn how to walk
and talk and sing and i think they tell
your fortune like a magic 8 ball this is
my favorite hatchimal so far this is
alicorn half owl happy unicorn so today
we're making a hatchimal cake to look
like owlicorn so let's get started the
recipe that we're making today is a
cotton candy flavored cake i've never
done that before and i thought it was so
fitting because aloe corn has those
cotton candy colors the things you'll
need will be three cups of cake flour
two cups of sugar one cup of milk two
cups of butter at room temperature two
teaspoons of cotton candy flavor quarter
teaspoon of pink gel color half a
teaspoon of salt one tablespoon of
baking powder and five eggs we're only
going to be using the whites now let's
put it all together first step to making
our cake whisk together your dry
ingredients flour baking powder and salt
and then whisk together till well
combined and set off to the side next
step cream together your butter and
sugar a good tip is you want the butter
to be at room temperature so it's a
little softer and easier to cream add
your sugar
then using an electric mixer mix
together on a medium speed until light
and fluffy this usually takes about two
to three minutes butter mixture is ready
we've also got our dry ingredients and
milk we're gonna alternate adding our
dry ingredients and milk to our butter
mixture starting and ending with dry to
add a third of the dry mix it up half of
the milk mix it up another third of the
dry mix it up second half of the milk
mix it up last of the dry and mix it up
don't forget to scrape down the sides
with your spatula our batter is looking
good it's a really thick batter i love
this now add the color and flavoring
pour in the cotton candy extract and
pink gel color all right let's mix it up
one more time yeah once the batter color
is nice and even you can set it off to
the side pancake batter is off to the
side and i know what you're thinking
well ro what about those eggs we never
added our eggs to the cake batter that
is an excellent question we're going to
be making a meringue and then fold
together with our cake batter so let's
get cracking so in the big bowl we want
our five egg whites to get an egg white
crack your egg i like to use the jiggle
method jiggle the yolk back and forth
between the two shells and allow the egg
white to drip to the bottom of the bowl
using an electric mixer mix together
until soft peaks start to form usually
takes a couple minutes on a high speed
just remember you want clean beaders to
do this when you're making the meringue
take your beaters out and the little tip
right here this is a little peak and
look it's soft it flops around
now gently fold in the meringue to the
pink cake batter in three parts scoop
i'm just gonna eyeball it this is about
a third if you've never folded before
it's not a mix where you mix rigorously
you want to keep the air in the batter
so what you do is you take a spatula and
you scoop underneath the batter
fold over the top and turn so you scoop
over and turn like this just keep adding
your meringue and folding it in it might
be hard to see on camera but the
meringue really fluffed up our batter it
is light it is fluffy and it is ready to
bake in front of me i have a six inch
round cake pan which i have greased and
lined with a piece of parchment paper at
the bottom so that when you plop the
cake out it won't stick to the sides and
this really unique easter egg mold i'll
put a link down below to where i found
this online i thought this would look
most like the egg like the hatchimals
egg they come with these little silicone
bases which you place on top of a baking
sheet and place the mold on top so that
while it's baking it doesn't move around
the tray and your batter will go
everywhere you're gonna fill these
almost all the way to the top and then
the leftover batter will go in our
little six inch round cotton candy cakes
are ready to bake heat your oven to 325
degrees and bake these larger egg cakes
for an hour and a half we're using a
slow bake method we're reducing the heat
and baking longer so that the cake will
bake evenly and it won't be burnt around
the sides and bake the little cake for
30 minutes our cakes have baked and had
plenty of time to cool i put the round
one off to the side now we're going to
assemble our cakes and decorate to
assemble we're going to basically glue
our two egg cakes together using our
little edible glue little buttercream
frosting pipe some buttercream icing on
top of one of the halves then place the
second half of the cake on top now pop
this in the freezer for 10 minutes so it
can chill together once the cake is
chilled cut off the bottom so our egg
can sit upright just like a hatchimal
what's really cool about the egg mold is
it has this zigzag impression at the top
and we're gonna use that as a guide
again using a small serrated knife we're
gonna cut along the line ready
we're almost done carving our cake we
just have to make a little space in the
middle for our hatchimal to sit inside
i'm gonna cut a little hole in the
middle about an inch in front of me i
have a turntable just to make icing a
little bit easier this part's totally
optional you don't need one then pipe a
thin layer of buttercream icing all the
way around and smooth it out with a
spatula don't worry it doesn't need to
look perfect because we're going to
cover the cake with fondant after a
bunch of smoothing with my spatula we're
going to set it in the fridge and while
this cake is chilling in the fridge we
are going to make our little hatchimal
our animal with our round cake we're
gonna make a big cake ball so to do that
we need to crumb our six inch cake so
cut it up into pieces
and over a large bowl and just rub the
pieces together use your hands crumb it
up okay this is looking good now add one
tablespoon of buttercream frosting boop
this is where you get your hands pretty
messy but it's fun just keep working it
into the dough once it starts to come
together just roll it into a ball place
on a plate and refrigerate it for about
20 minutes cake balls in the fridge in
front of me i rolled out a large
rectangle piece of marshmallow fondant
now we're gonna wrap it all the way
around our cake just gently press it
against the cake cut off this excess
fondant
get out of here
get out of here and then for the top
just gently tuck it in and use your
fingers in between each groove after
cutting off all the excess fondant at
the bottom and the back and pressing it
against the cake making it really smooth
looking we are going to decorate the
fondant to look like little alicorn
shells so on her shell there's like
cotton candy pink and this teal cotton
candy bluish color and it's splattered
all the way around the egg it's also
sparkly which we'll add later we want
the paint to dry first over here in
these two little bowls we have a cotton
candy and that same kind of teal blue
cotton candy colors i am splatter
painting this the same way i would a diy
pair of jeans or a craft project it's
going to get a little messy but a lot of
fun once we've got the cake all
splattered we're gonna set it off to the
side to dry while we make some more
fondant decorations for little owl acorn
now using some more marshmallow fondant
that i've dyed purple a darker purple
regular white black and kind of this
teal color we are gonna make the
features of owlcorn's face and we're
just gonna roll it out into a lock and
then i'm just gonna twist
to make a unicorn horn like that then
i'll press it flat so it can sit it's
either a unicorn horn or a really tall
poop to make the eyeballs grab the other
purple press flat using a small circle
cookie cutter cut out two eyeballs same
steps roll out the black fondant using a
number 12 tip to cut out some smaller
circles pinch two small balls out of the
white fondant and place them on top of
the black circles last but not least
we're gonna make the teal beak using
your fingers shape it to look like the
beak then using a fondant tool poking
holes boop for the nostrils
and creating a mouth i've got all of my
fondant decorations and i took the cake
ball out of the fridge next step is to
gently place it on top of the cake now
before you start frosting we're gonna
stick on the eyeballs because we want
them to look sunken in like the furs
coming around the eyes just like the
little hatchimals in a piping bag i have
some pink buttercream icing i dyed it to
look like a cotton candy color and the
tip at the end i'm using is a number 16.
it's a very small teeny open star tip
[Music]
final decoration step we're gonna dust a
little bit of rainbow disco dust this is
edible on the outside of the shell and
ta-da
here is the hatchimal cake that we made
today a big thank you to you guys for
suggesting something hatchimal themed i
really love this cake because it's
customizable you can make any hatchimal
whatever one is your favorite i'll be
posting a bunch of pictures and the
cotton candy cake recipe on
rosannapansino.com
instagram facebook and twitter so you
can check it out there and if you guys
make a hatchimal cake please take a
picture and send it to me i love seeing
your baking creations it just makes me
happy it makes my day and if you have
any other ideas for any other nerdy
nummies please let me know leave me a
comment down below and i will do my best
to make it happen alright thanks again
you guys bye-bye what do you think
i think she likes it
